alert.note: Alert for Boone; Montgomery (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 12:39PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Boone and southern Montgomery Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1239 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Crawfordsville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Boone and southern Montgomery Counties, including the following locations... Ladoga, New Market and New Ross. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 38 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
